desc.p: This field holds the delivery reference of incoming MT513
Validation Rules
Up to 35 Alpha numeric characters
System updated field
This field can be used for the input of miscellaneous fees, which the Broker may decide to pass on to the "Bank".
Validation Rules
Input is optional.
Field length is 1-15 numeric characters with 0-9 decimal places
The number of decimal places is dependant on the number of decimal places stated on the CURRENCY file for the TRADE.CCY
The amount will be defaulted into the relevant field on SEC.TRADE, in the event of a partial execution the full amount entered will be defaulted.
Records the Foreign Fee amount charged by the broker on the trade.

Field length is 1-15 numeric characters with 0-9 decimal places

The amount will be defaulted into the relevant field on SEC.TRADE, in the event of a partial execution the full amount entered will be defaulted.
Standard T24 reserved field.
Standard T24 reserved field.
Standard T24 reserved field.
Standard T24 alphanumeric field.

A maximum of 18 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the SEC.ACC.MASTER file.

This field holds the delivery reference of outgoing MT514
Validation Rules
Up to 35 characters in length
system updated field
Standard T24 customer field.
Validation Rules
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 10 characters may be entered.
Must be the key to a valid entry on the CUSTOMER.SECURITY file.
Duplicate BROKER.NO is not allowed when TRADE.CREATION is set to 'BY.BROKER'
Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
Validation Rules
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
This is a NOINPUT field.
Validation Rules
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 14 characters may be entered.
The following values are permitted: BROKER COUNTERPARTY CLIENT BANK-PORTFOLIO
Flag controlling whether or not Average Price for customer's is to be calculated or not.
Gets defaulted from SC.STD.SEC.TRADE. Also the user can override it.
Validation Rules
Only input of 'YES' or 'NO' allowed.
Optional Input.

This field can be modified with the following results YES - CU.COMMISSION, CU.COMM.TAX, CU.STAMP.TAX & CU.EBV.FEES will be recalculated. If CASH.CHRGS is set to 'NET' then the nominal will be recalculated taking into account any values that are in fields CU.BRKR.COMM, CU.FOREIGN.FEE, CU.COMMISSION, CU.COMM.TAX, CU.STAMP.TAX & CU.EBV.FEES, CU.FEES.MISC or CU.DISC.PCENT. NO - No charge/commissions will be recalculated, however, if CASH.CHRGS is set to 'NET' & there are any values in CU.BRKR.COMM, CU.FOREIGN.FEE, CU.COMMISSION, CU.COMM.TAX, CU.STAMP.TAX & CU.EBV.FEES, CU.FEES.MISC or CU.DISC.PCENT then the nominal will be recalculated.
Validation Rules
Mandatory if transaction is "cash"
YES or NO

Flag controlling whether the Text message displayed during partial execution to put the order to history should be displayed or not. Gets defaulted from SC.STD.SEC.TRADE. Also the user can override it.
Validation Rules
Only input of 'YES' or 'NO' is allowed.
Optional Input.
This field determines whether the cash amount entered in CU.CASH.AMOUNT field is to include charges (NET) or have charges applied in addition (GROSS).

NET - The nominal will be calculated so that when the charges are added to the trade, the total value of the trade matches the CU.CASH.AMOUNT. GROSS - The nominal is calculated & then the charges are added to the CU.CASH.AMOUNT.
Validation Rules
Mandatory Input if CU.CASH.AMOUNT field is used.
NET or GROSS
Each time the 'NET' option is used the system always tries to match the cash amount exactly, however, sometimes this is not possible & this field determines what to do with the transaction.

If set to 'UNDER/OVER' the system will calculate to the nearest trading unit under the cash amount for a purchase & to the nearest trading unit over the cash amount for a sale. If set to 'EXACT' the system will then allow the user to use the ADJUST.COMM field to determine whether to adjust the commission down to make the total trade equal the cash amount.
Validation Rules
"MANDATORY" field if the CASH.CHRGS field is set to 'NET' otherwise a 'NOINPUT' field.
'UNDER/OVER' or 'EXACT'
Determines how broker charges will be calculated. Can be BY.TRANCHE (default value if not set) or BY.BROKER.
BY.TRANCHE will calculate charges for each execution, BY.BROKER will calculate charges by broker, these charges will then be allocated on a pro-rate basis for each execution.
Specifies the amount of Customer Commission charged for the trade when dealing takes place between clients.
Validation Rules
Input is optional.
Field length is 1-15 numeric characters with 0-9 decimal places
The number of decimal places is dependant on the number of decimal places stated on the CURRENCY file for the TRADE.CCY
The amount will be defaulted into the relevant field on SEC.TRADE, in the event of a partial execution the full amount entered will be defaulted.
This field is populated only when the transaction is for "cash".

Customer commissions in SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS are defaulted from the CUSTOMER.CHARGE record for the customer using the SC.APPLICATION set of fields. It will use the set of fields linked to SC.TRADING if they are present and default to ALL otherwise. From there the system links to the SCTR.GROUP.CONDITION application and then onto the SCTR.CHARGE.PARAMETER application to get the actual FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record used. Some commissions have a tax code associated with them which is used to charge tax on the commission.
If Tax is raised on the customer commission then the amount of tax raised in the local currency of the system is recorded in this field.
Validation Rules
No input field automatically updated by the system.
This field is populated only when the transaction is for "cash".

Customer commissions in SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS are defaulted from the CUSTOMER.CHARGE record for the customer using the SC.APPLICATION set of fields. It will use the set of fields linked to SC.TRADING if they are present and default to ALL otherwise. From there the system links to the SCTR.GROUP.CONDITION application and then onto the SCTR.CHARGE.PARAMETER application to get the actual FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record used. Some commissions have a tax code associated with them which is used to charge tax on the commission.
If Tax is raised on the customer commission then the Tax Code used (from the TAX file) to calculate the tax on the commission is recorded in this field.
Validation Rules
No input field automatically updated by the system.
System populated field, the dealer desk that executed the transaction.
This field is populated only when the transaction is for "cash".

Customer commissions in SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS are defaulted from the CUSTOMER.CHARGE record for the customer using the SC.APPLICATION set of fields. It will use the set of fields linked to SC.TRADING if they are present and default to ALL otherwise. From there the system links to the SCTR.GROUP.CONDITION application and then onto the SCTR.CHARGE.PARAMETER application to get the actual FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record used. Some commissions have a tax code associated with them which is used to charge tax on the commission.

If Tax is raised on the customer commission then the amount is calculated in the local currency of the system and recorded in the COM.TAX.BCUR field. This field will contain the exchange rate used between the local currency of the system and the trade currency of the ORDER.BY.CUST, used in calculating the amount of tax in the Local currency.
Validation Rules
No input field automatically updated by the system.
This field is populated only when the transaction is for "cash".

Customer commissions in SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS are defaulted from the CUSTOMER.CHARGE record for the customer using the SC.APPLICATION set of fields. It will use the set of fields linked to SC.TRADING if they are present and default to ALL otherwise. From there the system links to the SCTR.GROUP.CONDITION application and then onto the SCTR.CHARGE.PARAMETER application to get the actual FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record used.
When the customer commissions are worked out the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE code used is put in this field.
Validation Rules
No input field automatically updated by the system.
This field is populated only when the transaction is for "cash".

Customer commissions in SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS are defaulted from the CUSTOMER.CHARGE record for the customer using the SC.APPLICATION set of fields. It will use the set of fields linked to SC.TRADING if they are present and default to ALL otherwise. From there the system links to the SCTR.GROUP.CONDITION application and then onto the SCTR.CHARGE.PARAMETER application to get the actual FT.COMMISSION.TYPE record used.
When the customer commission is calculated the percentage used to calculate the commission will be recorded in this field.
Validation Rules
No input field automatically updated by the system.
Records the currency of the Customer's Account
Information purposes only.
Validation Rules
No input required
Specifies the amount of Broker Commission charged to the Customer for the trade.
Validation Rules
Input is optional. If there is an input on the relevant field on SEC.OPEN.ORDER, then that value will default here.
Field length is 1-15 numeric characters with 0-9 decimal places
The number of decimal places is dependant on the number of decimal places stated on the CURRENCY file for the TRADE.CCY
The amount will be defaulted into the relevant field on SEC.TRADE according to the following equation:
Amount = (Executed.Nom / Ordered.Nom) * CU.BRKR.COMM
Pro-rated Amount = Original Amount Amount
Were:
Executed.Nom: is the nominal being executed (field 9.1 Cust.Nominal, new value)
Ordered.Nom: is the nominal ordered (field 9.1 Cust.Nominal, old value)
Amount: is the chargeable commission amount on the trade defaulted on the relevant field on SEC.TRADE
Pro-rated Amount: Is the commission amount left after execution of the order Overwrites current value
Broker number for the associated customer.
This field contains the cash amount that is to be traded.

If the CASH.CHRGS field is set to 'GROSS' then the cash amount will be used to calculate the nominal & any charges/commissions that apply will be added to this value, however, if the CASH.CHRGS field is set to 'NET' the cash amount will include all charges/commissions, adjusting the nominal to achieve this.
Validation Rules
Mandatory if ORDER.TYPE is "CASH"
This is the tax amount based on the commision charged.
This field is automatically updated when the CU.COMMISSION field is populated.
Validation Rules
"NOINPUT" field
Specifies the amount of Broker Commission charged to the Customer for the trade.
Validation Rules
Input is optional. If there is an input on the relevant field on SEC.OPEN.ORDER, then that value will default here.
Field length is 1-15 numeric characters with 0-9 decimal places
The number of decimal places is dependant on the number of decimal places stated on the CURRENCY file for the TRADE.CCY
The amount will be defaulted into the relevant field on SEC.TRADE according to the following equation:
Amount = (Executed.Nom / Ordered.Nom) * CU.COMMISSION
Pro-rated Amount = Original Amount Amount
Were:
Executed.Nom: is the nominal being executed (field 9.1 Cust.Nominal, new value)
Ordered.Nom: is the nominal ordered (field 9.1 Cust.Nominal, old value)
Amount: is the chargeable commission amount on the trade defaulted on the relevant field on SEC.TRADE
Pro-rated Amount: Is the commission amount left after execution of the order Overwrites current value
This field accepts any valid depository present in CUSTOMER.SECURITY application with CUSTOMER.TYPE defined as DEPOSITORY.
Validation Rules
This field can accept a maximum of 10 numeric characters.
This is an NO INPUT, System updated field.
This field gets mapped from CU.DEPOSITORY field in SEC.OPEN.ORDER.
If the CASH.ROUNDING field is set to 'EXACT' then this field becomes active to determine whether to reduce the commission in order to make the total trade match the cash amount exactly.

If set to 'YES' and the value of the total trade does not match the cash amount, the system will check to see if there is enough commission to cover the difference between the two figures. If there is the system will reduce of commission (and tax on commission) to make the values match. If there is not enough commission to achieve this an error message will be displayed & the user will have to choose another option if they require the trade to proceed. If set to 'NO' and the value of the total trade does not match the cash amount an error message will be displayed & the user will have to choose another option if they require the trade to proceed. Validation Rules
"MANDATORY" field if the CASH.ROUNDING field is set to 'EXACT' otherwise a 'NOINPUT' field.
'YES' or 'NO'
This field is populated automatically when the transaction is "cash" & is calculated using CU.DISC.PCENT
Validation Rules
"NOINPUT" field

Optional input field detailing the percentage customer discount in percentage terms. This discount will be defaulted from SEC.OPEN.ORDER if there is an input in the relevant field. It will feed through to the CU.DISC.PCENT field on the subsequent SEC.TRADE.
Validation Rules
Input is optional. If there is an input on the relevant field on SEC.OPEN.ORDER, then that value will default here.
Field length is 1-15 numeric characters with 0-9 decimal places
Input can be a percentage provided the percentage sign follows the numeric figure e.g. 13.25%. Input is allowed between 0 and 100

Fields ORDER.BROKER to EXE.BY.BROKER form a related multi value set. Standard T24 amount field.

This is a NOINPUT field.
Specifies the amount of Tax on the Securities up to the Value Date of the trade. The calculation is used for Tax payable on any Bond / Share on Sale.
The Tax rate to be applied is fetched from the field CU.WHT.PERC.
Validation Rules
1-18 numeric characters (including up to 3 decimal places, dependant on currency).
Cum and Ex Indicators for the transaction
This field allows entry of Cum and Ex indicators relating to the Transaction. Where these apply, they will be mapped onto the relevant SWIFT message and are mandatory from a business point of view.
NB. These codes are validated against DE.TRANSLATION to ensure that they exist and are prefixed with 'SW' (i.e. SWIFT).
The list of valid codes must also be entered in the application SM.PARAMETER, key SYSTEM.
Values entered here will be carried forward to SEC.TRADE.
10 Type A (alphanumeric) characters.
Defaults the Account for the Customer from SEC.OPEN.ORDER.
Validation Rules
Default value = the Account specified in SEC.OPEN.ORDER
Must be a valid Account for the Customer

Field specifying whether the order being executed is an odd lot order and is allowed to be specified only for ODD LOT SECURITY as defined in SECURITY.MASTER. If the order is an odd lots order then the order will be validated against the odd lots fields on the SECURITY.MASTER record to ensure the order is valid.

Percentage of customer spread which would be applied over the broker price. It is the spread between the broker price and customer price and would be applied only for internal brokers in a scenario when portfolio is shared across companies.
Validation Rules
Flag controlling whether Broker Charges and Commission is to be Prorated across customer's or not. Gets defaulted from SC.STD.SEC.TRADE. Also the user can override it.
Validation Rules
Only input of 'YES' or 'NO' is allowed.
Input of 'YES' is not allowed when TRADE.CREATION is BY.BROKER'
Optional Field.

Yes/No field defaulted from PRORATA.NOM field in SC.STD.SEC.TRADE. If set to "YES" the nominals of each broker would be prorated to all the customers based on outstanding order nominals. Rounding differences if any would be adjusted against the first customer to the extent possible and further to the second customer and so on
Validation Rules
Only input of 'YES' or 'NO' is allowed.
Optional Input.
Routing company, i.e. the company through which the trade should be executed.

Field identifying the cross trading (internal) portfolio to be used in a multi company order/execution scenario when portfolio is shared across companies. If this portfolio is specified, there would be two trades : One between the cross trading portfolio and street side broker and the other between the cross trading portfolio and actual customers.
Validation Rules
Must be a valid dealer book portfolio

This field is only populated if the SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS record was created from the SEC.OPEN.ORDER record which in turn was created by the ORDER.BY.CUST application & the transaction was a 'SWITCH' with a value in the SPLIT.CHRGS field.
NULL - If this field is blank then any commission calculated will be charged on both the purchase & the sale at the full rate. XX% - The percentage of the charges to be applied to the trade .

This field controls the SEC.TRADE creation from SC.EXE.SEC.ORDERS.
Example:
If Trade Creation is 'BY.PORTFOLIO' then SEC.TRADE's will be created for each Portfolio.
To accept an option PARENT.CHILD. This will trigger generation of parent and child trades on execution of individual order. This field cannot be entered if order is already a parent child order
Validation Rules
Valid options are 'BY.CUST', 'BY.DEPO', 'BY.BROKER', 'BY.PORTFOLIO','PARENT.CHILD'.

This multi-valued field displays the TRADE.TIME for each multi-valued BROKER. If the TRADE.TIME.FLAG in SC.STD.SEC.TRADE is set to 'YES' then the time is defaulted to the current system time.
If input is made into this field, the TRADE.TIME is written back to the associated SEC.OPEN.ORDER record to record the details of the trade.
Validation Rules
A maximum of 11 characters may be entered.
In the format HH:MM:SS.

No input field
Specifies the rate of exchange between the Trade Currency and the Br Account Ccy
Validation Rules
Default value = rate calculated as per the CURRENCY file records.
Where input manually the rate must fall between the parameters set on the CURRENCY files.
Reason of MT509 rejection.
This field is used only for inward message processing. Allowed value YES. Creation of trade will happen only on full execution of order though multiple MT513 are received.

This field is used only for inward message processing. Allowed Value YES. Enable single trade creation for a day.Creation of trade will happen at the end of day before COB after the cut off time specified in EXEC.CUT.OFF.
To be set to YES if the corresponding SEC.TRADE needs to be authorised automatically.
To be set to YES if MT514 is to be sent.
Allowed value is YES
This Field is to determine whether the order is a parent order
This field will accept alphanumeric Value
Unique parent reference that is common for both parent and child orders and will serve as a link.

This field will be populated from SEC.OPEN.ORDER record field EXE.HLT.Allowed options are YES,NO or NULL. On setting YES system will throw an override on committing th record. NO or NULL will allow the process of executing order.
This field will be populated from SEC.OPEN.ORDER record field TRADE.HLT.Allowed options are YES,NO or NULL. On setting YES system will be create the SEC.TRADE in IHLD status.
This field is used to specify whether parent trades are to be created based on each depository.
The value will be defaulted from similar field of SC.STD.SEC.TRADE but can be manually overridden.
This field has a significance only if either TRADE.CREATION field is set as PARENT.CHILD or order itself is created as a parent
child order.
Allowed values is YES or No

Minimum lot using which nominal will be executed. This will be defaulted from SEC.OPEN.ORDER. Value should be in multiple of trading units and nominal execution will consider this field instead of trading units from SECURITY.MASTER
The field gets defaulted from the UPFRONT.SEC in SEC.OPEN.ORDER
/Validation Rules:
This is a NOINPUT field
